page.title: 11WENNINGTON HALL SCHOOL
page.content: Wennington Hall School is administered by the Lancashire Education Authority and caters on a residential basis for the special educational needs of 54 boys of secondary school age and of normal intelligence, who have difficulties associated with their academic, social, emotional and/or behavioural development which make normal day secondary education inappropriate for them. The school aims to give a balanced education with intensive remedial or other help where needed, leading where possible to external examinations and enabling the successful return home of a boy to attend his local day secondary school. Where for some reason this is impossible the school aims to equip a boy to obtain suitable employment on leaving. Close links are maintained with the careers service.
